Intentamos tomar un caf� y merendar algo en el sal�n que tienen en el hall de entrada pero, a pesar de tener muchas mesas vac�as, la se�orita encargada de la sala nos dijo con muy malos modos que todo estaba reservado y que, aunque fueramos a estar poco tiempo no pod�amos sentarnos en ninguna mesa. Entiendo que, si todo est� reservado no pueda sentarme, pero no entiendo ni me parece aceptable los malos modos de dicha encargada. Creo que, un hotel de esa categor�a, si tuvieran una encargada profesional y que tratase a los clientes como se merecen podr�a haber ofrecido alternativas para quedarnos en alguna otra zona del hotel, o por lo menos, habernos tratado con correcci�n. (Translated by Google)
We tried to have a coffee and a snack in the lounge that they have in the entrance hall but, despite having many empty tables, the lady in charge of the room told us with very bad manners that everything was reserved and that, even if we were going to be For a short time we couldn't sit at any table. I understand that, if everything is reserved, I cannot sit down, but I do not understand nor do I find the bad manners of said manager acceptable. I think that a hotel of that category, if they had a professional manager who treated customers as they deserve, could have offered alternatives for us to stay in some other area of ??the hotel, or at least treated us correctly. Do not forget that I will not enter your hotel again, nor recommend it among my foreign clients who often visit Madrid.

(Translated by Google) Good afternoon, The other day I was having tea in the lounge and what a disappointment to see that the seats of a hotel of that quality have all the arms damaged in the upholstery. I think that this type of detail should be taken into account in a 5-star hotel and having been open for such a short time. It gives a feeling of neglect no matter how beautiful it is decorated. I also have to say that they lacked time to take the teapot from us when we had not even drunk all the tea. I imagine that it is due to the large number of people that are received now, but that should not affect the service,
